title: Nathaniel Smithson House
text:
The Nathaniel Smithson House is a property in <a href="Peytonsville%2C%20Tennessee">Peytonsville, Tennessee</a>, which was listed on the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in 1988.
The house is a two-story brick <a href="Central%20passage%20plan%20architecture">central passage plan</a> house, built c. 1840. The front facade has brick is laid in <a href="Flemish%20bond">Flemish bond</a> and a one-story <a href="Italianate%20architecture">Italianate</a>-style porch added in c. 1880. Brick elsewhere is laid in five course <a href="Common%20bond%20%28bricklaying%29">common bond</a>.
When listed the property included two <a href="contributing%20buildings">contributing buildings</a> and one non-contributing building on an area of . A one-story frame <a href="smokehouse">smokehouse</a> built c. 1880, behind the main house, is the second contributing building. A one-story c.1900 frame building which served as a store elsewhere was moved to the property later was deemed non-contributing.
The NRHP eligibility of the property was covered in a 1988 study of Williamson County historical resources.
